word_mean: 营养不良，营养失调：可由饮食不均衡或不足，或者食物的利用或同化作用不良致成

sentence.Network_cn: 营养不良的人更有可能被传染。

entry.def: If someone is suffering from malnutrition, they are physically weak and extremely thin because they have not eaten enough food.

example.ex: Infections are more likely in those suffering from malnutrition.
example.tran: 营养不良的人更有可能被传染。

means.word_mean: 1. a state of poor nutrition; can result from insufficient or excessive or unbalanced diet or from inability to absorb foods

stems_affixes.type_exp: =nourish,to suckle 表示"营养,养育,哺乳"

stems_affixes.word_buile: nutrit营养,养育,哺乳+ious……的→adj.有营养的
nutrit营养,养育,哺乳+ion表名词→n.营养,营养学
mal坏,恶+content满意的→adj.不满的 n.不满者
mala=mal坏,恶+prop恰当+ism行为,现象,状态→[用字]不恰当;来自一喜剧中的Mrs.Malaprop,以用词错误闻名
mal坏,恶+content满意的→adj.不满的 n.不满者

Sentence.sentence: It found that human-influenced climate change was raising the global death rates from illnesses including malnutrition (营养不良)and heat-related health problems.
Malnutrition has caused serious health problems in poor countries

sentences.en: In Africa, there are a lot of children suffering from severe malnutrition.
sentences.cn: 在非洲有大批严重营养不良的孩子。

jushi.english: It is a classic case of malnutrition.
jushi.chinese: 这是营养不良的典型病例。
